thread.title: Ctrip, Qunar Said to Plan Merger of Chinese Travel Sites
thread.title_full: Ctrip, Qunar Said to Plan Merger of Chinese Travel Sites - Bloomberg Business

author: Lulu Yilun Chen
title: Ctrip, Qunar Said to Plan Merger of Chinese Travel Sites
text:
Two of China’s biggest online travel-booking websites, Ctrip.com and Qunar, are in talks to merge, according to people familiar with the matter.
The announcement may come as soon as Monday night, the people said, asking not to be identified because the deal hasn’t been made public. The two companies -- Ctrip.com International Ltd. and Qunar Cayman Islands Ltd. -- have a combined market value of $15.6 billion, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.
The proposed deal comes about five months after Qunar, controlled by Baidu Inc., rejected a buyout offer from Ctrip.com amid fierce competition for online bookings in China. A combined travel company would have posted revenue of $1.85 billion in the past 12 months, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.
The acquisition would add to the $62.5 billion of Internet deals involving
Chinese companies during the past year, data compiled by Bloomberg show.
